title: Create feature landing pages (TUI/CLI/SDK/Features)
description:
**As a** documentation user
**I want** dedicated landing pages for each major section (Features, SDK, TUI Guide)
**So that** I get a clear overview before diving into detailed documentation

**Context:**
Navigation reorganization (SOUL-175) requires index pages for Features, SDK, and optionally TUI Guide. These serve as gateways that provide context and guide users to specific topics.

**Reference Analysis (.local repos):**

**MkDocs Material** (.local/mkdocs-material/docs/setup/index.md, plugins/index.md):
- Clear section overview with icon
- Brief description of what the section covers
- Grid of links to subsections with descriptions
- Uses navigation.indexes feature

**Typer** (.local/typer/docs/tutorial/index.md):
- Progressive learning path
- Clear "What you'll learn" section
- Links to first steps

**Technical Notes:**
- navigation.indexes already enabled (mkdocs.yml:58)
- When nav has 'section: section/index.md', clicking section shows index
- Use card grid CSS from SOUL-176
- Reference existing docs structure

**Files to Create:**

1. **docs/features/index.md** - Feature overview landing
2. **docs/sdk/index.md** - SDK documentation landing
3. **docs/tui-guide/index.md** (optional) - Can use user-guide/tui.md

```markdown
# Consoul SDK

Embed Consoul's AI capabilities into your Python applications.

## Overview

The Consoul SDK provides a Python API for integrating AI chat, tool calling, and conversation management into your applications.

## Quick Start

\`\`\`python
from consoul import Consoul

console = Consoul()
response = console.chat("What is 2+2?")
print(response)
\`\`\`

## SDK Features

- **Simple API** - Intuitive Python interface
- **Multi-Provider** - Support for all Consoul providers
- **Tool Integration** - Custom tool registration
- **Async Support** - Async-first design
- **Type Safety** - Full type hints

## Guides

- [Tool Calling Integration](tool-calling-integration.md)
- [Custom Tools](#)
- [Provider Configuration](#)
- [Best Practices](#)

## API Reference

See [API Documentation](../api/index.md) for complete reference.
```
